key_points: Vice President Mike Pence called Vice President-elect Kamala Harris to offer congratulations.
This is the first known contact between the outgoing and incoming administrations.
President Donald Trump has not reached out to President-elect Joe Biden and has not invited him to the White House.
Trump has been making baseless claims about voter fraud and has not accepted the election results.
Pence has distanced himself from Trump, especially after the Capitol siege, and has defended Biden's win.
Pence will attend Biden's inauguration, unlike Trump who will skip it.
The call between Pence and Harris was described as a 'good call,' with Pence offering his assistance.
Pence has been fulfilling ceremonial duties and thanked National Guard members protecting the Capitol.
This call represents the traditional show of comity between outgoing and incoming leaders that Trump has flouted.
Biden said he would be 'honored' to have Pence attend his inauguration, underscoring the importance of maintaining historical precedents for peaceful transfer of power.
